intro: Lotononis aristata var. gazensis, commonly known as the Gazeni daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
